page.title: 10LIFE IN MY STREET
page.content: My street is called Rylston Road. It is not very big, the houses are all terraced, which means they are all joined together. In the mornings my street is quite busy with mums taking children to school. There are lots of cars down my street; most of the people park their cars along the curb,some park their cars in their garages. This causes a problem for the milk man because he can't park his float in the kerb. We also have a post man who comes to our street at about 8.15 a.m. In the evening some children play on their bikes. A few of us play games.Some of these games are called it,123 and sticky toffee. A few of us bring out card games called Top trumps. This is what it is like to live in my street.
